alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 7:48PM MST until January 28 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...A prolonged period of light to moderate snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon and Albany counties including Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Baggs, and the Ferris, Seminoe, and Shirley Mountains. The highest totals will be found near higher ridgetops. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Saturday. A second wave of snow will be possible on Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
